references.A02MOT01USGP: Motacq, M. D. 2002. Morphological and molecular analysis of a contact zone in the Neotoma fuscipes complex. Journal of Mammalogy 83:866-883.

habitat_description: This species, once designated conspecific with N. fuscipes (Matocq 2002), is endemic to southern and central California. It is widespread along the western slope of the Sierra Nevada below 2150 m. Primary habitats include chaparral and forested environments with moderate canopy and dense, brushy understory. This species is absent from cultivated land and open grasslands of the Central Valley.  (Brylski 2005 [CAWHR] based on Zeiner et al. 1990). It is most abundant where canopy cover is >90% and undisturbed by fire (Lee 1963, Tevis 1956) and least abundant in relatively open areas (Fitch 1947).
